item.title: Former Elder Scrolls Online Employees Form New Indie Studio
item.content:encoded:
A new indie studio formed from former ZeniMax employees, with leads from Elder Scrolls Online and Project Blackbird, has been revealed.

Zenimax Online Studios, formed in 2007, had a massive following thanks, in part, to The Elder Scrolls Online. The MMORPG has continued to bring in new players daily, selling almost $2 billion in sales since 2014. Unfortunately, due to the latest Microsoft layoffs, over 300 employees from the company were let go. This includes some who worked on a yet-to-be-revealed new IP called Project Blackbird, which Xbox cancelled. However, it seems some of the laid-off crew have come together to form a new, employee-owned indie studio.

Sackbird Studios Officially Announced, Run by Former ZeniMax Online Leads

In a post on the new studio‚Äôs blog, former leads at ZeniMax Online Studios have formed Sackbird Studios. The crew consists of 10 former employees of the Bethesda-owned studio. Many of them worked on The Elder Scrolls Online and the cancelled Project Blackbird. Furthermore, it is entirely employee-owned and has already been funded for multiple years. In a statement, Sackbird Studios COO David Worley said,

‚ÄúAfter years in AAA, we wanted the freedom to take smart risks without waiting for a greenlight or chasing quarterly targets,‚Äù states Worley. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre fully employee-owned and funded, which means we only answer to people who are passionate about games.‚Äù 

Another statement, this time from CEO Lee Ridout, states,

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre grateful for our time at ZeniMax Online Studios; it shaped us as developers and as people,‚Äù said Ridout. ‚ÄúWhen I learned that Blackbird was being cancelled and a lot of people were losing their jobs, it lit a fire. We realized the best way to protect our craft‚Äîand our team‚Äîwas to create a studio where creative independence isn‚Äôt negotiable.‚Äù

At the moment, the team is not ready to share its first title, but promises that it will launch on PC and consoles. While the team is grateful for the time they spent at ZeniMax Online Studios, it seems they aren‚Äôt pulling any stops to ensure its work gets out of the door. It‚Äôll be excited to see what Sackbird Studios creates, especially if it takes from the cancelled Project Blackbird.

Are you happy to hear about Sackbird Studios? What do you think? Let us know in the comments, on the forums, and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more on Elder Scrolls, check out our articles on Online‚Äôs crossplay and a potential leak for The Elder Scrolls 6. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: A Universal Time (AUT) Codes (October 2025)
item.content:encoded:
A Universal Time is an action-adventure game within Roblox, boasting core RPG elements and a world that‚Äôs been heavily inspired by Jojo‚Äôs Bizarre Adventure and other similar anime stories. A Universal Time requires players to explore a large world and gain powers along the way. Alongside their exploration of the map, they will be required to take on various opponents, including NPCs as well as real players. Although the biggest inspiration for A Universal Time is Jojo‚Äôs Bizarre Adventure, with the game including many of the anime‚Äôs ‚ÄòStands‚Äô, it also showcases characters from other popular anime, including Dragon Ball, One Piece, and more. 

You will have to progress through the game to get stronger and unlock more powerful moves, and for newer players to the game, that can be a daunting task. With both PvP and PvE fights involved, getting ahead of the competition fast is of utmost importance, and using codes is a good way to make some quick progress. A Universal Time codes give players various rewards in the game, including Skin Chests, UCoins, UShards, and more, all of which will come in handy to the average player.

All New A Universal Time Codes (October 2025)

  • KARSWHAT (NEW)
  • SORRYFORDELYA (NEW)

Expired A Universal Time Codes

  • GUTSISHERE
  •  HUTAO

  •  OpenTheDOOOR

  •  SAVEDAUTFROMSHADOW

  •  SHADOW

  •  SORRYFORSHUTDOWNAGAIN

  •  SUMMERUPDATEPHASE3
  •  PHASETHREE

Although the game currently has only two active codes, more are likely to be added in the future. A Universal Time codes often have fixed timeframes when they will be usable, meaning that when existing codes expire, new ones will be added.

With this in mind, we encourage players to bookmark this page, as any new codes or expirations will be updated here immediately. Although you can keep track of new codes by joining the game‚Äôs official Discord or through their socials, keeping tabs on our page is going to be the easiest way to do so.

How To Redeem A Universal Time Codes

A Universal Time is one of those games where, before you can redeem codes, there is a criterion that needs to be met. Before you can make use of the above codes, you will have to join the A Universal Time Roblox group. Once you have done that, follow the steps given below to redeem your A Universal Time rewards. 

  • Launch Roblox and open A Universal Time
  • Press the ‚ÄòM‚Äô key on your keyboard to open up the shop
  • Select the Miscellaneous option to reach the codes tab
  • Enter one of the active codes given above into the text box
  • Click on ‚ÄòRedeem Code‚Äô to receive your rewards

For more Roblox Guides and trending games, check out Weak Legacy 2 Codes, which is a hugely popular game now on Roblox.
